name: TheAtlantic
text: A poem by @MargaretAtwood, first printed in The Atlantic in 1980: https://t.co/JixlsWjvWb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Spending a year of their life in ... service projects is not what most college students would normally have chosen, but this is not a normal year," @EllenRuppelShel writes. https://t.co/oJnGz7feEu

name: TheAtlantic
text: The president’s two strongest instincts stand pitted against each other: his need for attention and his need to punish enemies, Andrew Ferguson writes. https://t.co/6rdnGRGvGw

name: TheAtlantic
text: This week, two high-profile incidents laid bare America’s racial contract. Both found accelerants in social media and provoked questions about its role in society. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/9IhFPMhtmi

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen: @JamesFallows joins the "Social Distance" podcast to give @katlwells and @jameshamblin some historical perspective. https://t.co/YdFreNPJHD

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: "My children are both respite from all the tragedy transpiring in the world, and a reminder of how high the stakes are." 

A powerful, moving essay from @ClintSmithIII: https://t.co/nWHNIk3d93

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: “Structural racism has been a public-health crisis for much longer than the pandemic has.” https://t.co/wrk260SFVd

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "In 1896, Frederick Hoffman deployed data to substantiate racist ideas that are still building caskets for black bodies today.... Black life is the 'hopeless problem,' as Hoffman wrote."
Nothing started yesterday, @DrIbram suggests: 
https://t.co/wGe5FTK5aB

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "I think she’s emerged as one of the most thought-provoking writers on the coronavirus, and I wanted to encourage people to think about her argument.” @DLeonhardt recommends @JuliaLMarcus’s work in The Atlantic—here’s her latest: https://t.co/dzXwJYO6Ch

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: It’s not a question of if, but where. https://t.co/iPu5nlAP6z

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 counsels a reader who is having difficulty coming to terms with her daughter living abroad. https://t.co/hwiBqYQfk6

name: TheAtlantic
text: A new law gives some American workers paid time off if they get COVID-19. But it doesn’t apply to all workers, putting their jobs in jeopardy, @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/fOld4XbuGy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Yesterday, when America needed real leadership, the office of the president stood vacant," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/mugA0ncZyc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @fhill_official: "The philosophy of force and violence to obtain freedom has long been employed by white people and explicitly denied to black Americans." This is essential from @kcarterjackson: https://t.co/ZaYiZMKNXK

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos: The Works of Christo - 30 images of some of the enormous art installations created over the years by Christo and his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude. Christo passed away yesterday at the age of 84. https://t.co/jet3qwMVu4 https://t.co/z1TUqFfd4p

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @bethfertig: In the middle of the pandemic, undocumented immigrants with COVID-19 have been forgoing health care because they're scared to alert federal immigration authorities, @JeremyRaff reports. https://t.co/dgh8cXjPZD

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: The Works of Christo via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/cpyhMW8xeT
